title: White cop who shot unarmed black woman in her home resigned before he was fired
text:
Fort Worth Police Officer Aaron Dean resigned before he was fired for shooting Atatiana Jefferson. (Picture: Facebook/ Fort Worth Police Department)

A white cop who shot an unarmed black woman in her home resigned just before he was fired.

Officer Aaron Dean shot 28-year-old Atatiana Jefferson through her bedroom window as she babysat her eight-year-old nephew at her home in Fort Worth, Texas on Sunday.

Dean responded to Jefferson’s house in an unmarked police car for a welfare check after a concerned neighbor reported Jefferson’s front door was open. Body camera footage from the incident shows Dean as he fires one shot through the closed window.

At a Monday press conference, Police Chief Ed Kraus said that he planned fire fire Dean on Monday – but Dean resigned before Kraus got the chance.

‘He resigned before his opportunity to be cooperative,’ Kraus said, adding that his department planned to interview Dean on Monday before he quit.

Moments before the shooting, Jefferson had been playing video games with her nephew, her family said.

Dean is seen in body cam footage approaching the house. He shines a flashlight through Jefferson’s window and shouts, ‘Put your hands up – show me your hands,’ seconds before shooting Jefferson.

The Fort Worth Police Department said that Dean never announced himself as a police officer before shooting, the Dallas News reported.

Kraus said: ‘Had the officer not resigned, I would have fired him for violations for several policies, including our use of force policy, or deescalation policy and unprofessional conduct.’

He added that Dean still faces criminal charges as well as potential civil rights violations.

Jefferson’s brother, Darius Carr said: ‘This man murdered someone. He should be arrested.’

Lee Merrit, a lawyer for Jefferson’s family, called the department’s response to the situation ‘absurd’ and called the wellness check ‘the equivalent of SWAT.’

Kraus said he brought the case to the FBI, but it is unclear whether they will review it.

Jefferson’s death has caused an uproar in the Fort Worth area.

It came shortly after the October 2 sentencing of Fort Worth Police Officer Amber Guyger, who was given just ten years in jail for killing her neighbor in his own apartment.
description: Officer Aaron Dean shot 28-year-old Atatiana Jefferson through her bedroom window as she babysat her nephew at her home in Fort Worth, Texas
